author: revelar
title: Duo - Filipino Gameplay
description: NFT based play-to-earn games often focus on natively English-speaking cultures, which diminishes the possibility of a rich global community.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge to bring the DUO NFTs to a broader audience not fluent in the English language (it's current native tokens) is of the most importance to it's future success, not only to Revelar, but to the Cardano Community on a more global scale and adoptability. This impact to bring on new players from other cultures/ ethnic backgrounds through the translation of it's content is something that every project launched now and in the future of the NFTs market, should be striving towards as Cardano grows to become a universal blockchain from all walks of life. It is no secret that cryptocurrency and blockchain technology, aside from Non Fungible Tokens, is still cursed by the poorly represented media presence along with it's overall complexity before further global adoption. More so for games launched on blockchains, this particularly could be a stepping stone in the right direction in terms of both adoption into Cardano NFTs and the Cardano community growth as a whole. The challenges are defined clearly, one line resonates more than others in this particular proposal when describing the solution adding, "porting game content across linguistic and cultural boundaries, more gamers from around the world are given access to a global community in a way that is more familiar to them". This is definitely something within game development across multiple nations must take into account when creating something for everyone.
f6_assessments.q1: Taken into consideration the accomplishments of Revelar and the DUO NFT card game through prior Catalyst funding, this proposal has stated clearly and definitively the solutions to making its game even more successful, by adding value to it's current form, and introducing it to more people from various cultures. With regional marketing outlined as one way to expand and promote the additions, this will help the game itself and the ecosystem of Cardano by adding new users from various backgrounds. Having a strong experienced set of team members, all with mentioned credentials and experience from previous funding rounds, the plan to budget for partnering with Linguistic experts and having a set timeline in order to accomplish the challenges in place, seems very reasonable for on-time completion. Also highlighted within are remote collaboration risks, which members and attendees to Catalyst Townhall Meetings surely understand all too well, can be difficult to manage and plan. These factors have not been missed by the proposer and their team efforts moving forward will rely heavily on communication to and from existing and additional members. Can not disagree with what the proposer has presented in any area except in regards to "Profuct fit:" the last sentence has been cut off short. (an editing error)
f6_assessments.q2: Within the proposal it has been clearly understood these tasks will be somewhat of a challenge, mostly in adoption of new users. But the success of said challenges are more than achievable given the allotted timeline the roadmap describes. There are systems available for translating material today making it easier and perhaps less of an issue to possibly complete this idea even sooner than the proposed target, but as the proposer stated early on, being politically correct and not disrespectful to other cultural differences with the comical material, will be one of the biggest challenges to solve by the regional linguistic members who will determine what's best for the game and it's audience. This proposal is solving a problem many we in the crypto and NFT space find to be lacking, be that blockchain or games, we're all humans who want to be understood and express ourselves. DUO's card game is attempting to bridge that gap using humor that everyone understands on a more global scale. Because honestly, who doesn't love a good laugh.

f6_assessments.q0:
Games can be a great part of Cardano. I like the simplicity of the Duo games. And the simplicity of the objectives of this proposal.

Translations into languages other English are important ways to increase adoption. What impresses me positively, and hopefully voters will recognise is the practical and detailed criteria expressed for producing excellent translations. Pointed out as “risks” I see the issues as awareness of the dimensions of quality for this product.

* Humor is a universal concept but it is heavily influenced by our language and cultural experiences. By porting game content to different languages and adding in culturally relevant humor, Duo can create a truly global user base whilst accelerating the adoption of crypto for all.

* Lost in translation: To facilitate the porting and creation of content in different languages, we need to partner with native speakers and people who understand the culture. 

* Cultural translation - Some of the current humor archetypes within the Duo humor archetypes are funny in English, however, they may not be funny in other cultures or languages because they are not compatible with the culturally accepted humor. 

* Remote collaboration risks - The proposal will most certainly result in a global collaborative effort with parties working remotely. 

* Product fit: we are keeping the game-play of Duo simple Translating content into another language does not guarantee the adoption of that content by the intended audience. There is a chance that the game of Duo may not resonate with the intended audience as expected. To mitigate this and we will also

Presuming the Revelar team can implement according to these criteria, I strongly agree that the Impact will be positive.
f6_assessments.q1:
In start-ups or projects expanding to new markets there are three approaches possible.
1). Organic Growth (build a team)
2). Buy an existing team
3) Partner (or contract for expertise) with an existing team

Since the proposal team will be non-native speakers, they aim to

a). partner with multiple entities/people capable of delivering content, 
b). (most importantly), cross-validating previously created content. 

Revelar has chosen partnering. In this case outsourcing to partners who will be responsible for creating content appropriate to their language. Entirely cost effective and sensible.

Using more than one translator, to provide linguistic and contextual translation.

The proposers strategy of remote working is entirely appropriate for the kind of work to be done under this proposal. Limiting the need for synchronous communication with clear planning ahead of time for what needs to be done and by when. All in all a great plan that should be perfectly feasible, if they execute as planned and can find the desired standard of translating partners within the budgeted amounts. But seems reasonable to expect them to be able to do so.
f6_assessments.q2: As is required in the CA guidelines for assessing clarity/ audibility. Scoring means making a determination that the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. Based on my review of this proposal and the actual product, voters can be confident that expectations have been clearly established up front. Since the team has had a MVP in play for more than130 days and has user experience, the material to be translated, lithesome modification and or adaptation to local humour exists. Thus the process of translating by partners is should be sufficient to allow me, or the voters to assess progress.

f6_assessments.q0: Given the information provided, I think that the proposal effectively addresses the challenge setting, but I do have a comment for the proposers. The main goal of the project is to translate the Duo NFT card game into other languages to make them more applicable to non-English speakers. I believe that this goal is directly in line with the challenge setting to onboard new members into the cardano community from East Asia. By translating the game into other languages, it opens the door for new people to discover cardano and the many other services it provides. These people who play the game might become voters, stakers, proposers, or even CAs/vCAs with time. However, the proposers did not mention which languages they will translate the game into. Based on the title of the proposal, “Filipino gameplay,” I assume that it will be translated into Filipino. However, the proposers could have made this more clear throughout the proposal as well. Having this information more clearly presented could make a big difference in perceived impact. For example, if the game was translated into a language that is spoken by over 1 billion people (Chinese) versus about 75 million for Filipino, it would make a big difference in terms of potential number of people it will reach. Making this information crystal clear in the body of the proposal would make it more understandable for voters, especially since the proposers have other proposals with similar goals. (score given: 4)
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the information provided, I believe that this proposal will be successfully implemented. The proposers themselves all have the necessary qualifications and skills that will be needed to make this proposal happen. For example, they have skills in development, marketing, communications, etc. Additionally, the game is already in development, so I think that translating it should be a relatively easier task than the actual backend development. One concern I had that the proposers addressed is how they will translate the jokes appropriately for the different user base. Their solution of cross-referencing different translators should mitigate the risk of cross-cultural misinterpretation. 
The proposers listed a solid roadmap that is well thought out. It has a good breakdown of the different tasks and when they will be completed, such as finding the translator (2 weeks), translating (2-4 weeks), etc. Given the scope of the project, I think that the time allocated for each step is sufficient. 
The proposers also provided a good breakdown of the budget. I can easily see where the funds will be going, which gives me confidence in the success of the proposal. I have not personally hired a translator before to translate a game, but I think that the funds requested are sufficient given the scope of this proposal. (score given: 5)
f6_assessments.q2: Given the information provided, I think that this proposal is auditable. The proposers listed a dedicated domain where anyone can check up on the proposal at any time. This site is very important because it will be the link between the developers and the community in terms of auditing. A page will be created on said website where people can see the progress of the translation. Additionally, the proposers listed a good number of numerical KPIs that the community can use to make sure the proposal was successful. For example, they have listed the number of new players in relation to 3, 6, and 12 month intervals, which is simple enough to confirm. They say that these new players must be speakers of the language and will be in their discord server. I am personally not sure how exactly the proposers will know that a certain member of the discord is a Filipino speaker, but I trust that they can find a way to do this. Addressing this question would strengthen the proposal’s auditability even more. Overall, if these metrics are published on the site, I don't see any issue with auditing this proposal. (score given: 5)

f6_assessments.q0: I was completely sold when I read the Afrikaans language specific proposal from the same team. This is practically a copy of that, so much so that they are still talking about Afrikaans, although they should have switched to highlighting their merits regarding Tagalog, the official language of the Philippines, alongside English. $4,750 USD is not a lot of money but, for fairness sake, it’s better used for proposals that were perfected to hit the challenge brief. This one doesn’t talk much about East Asia at all.
f6_assessments.q1: With the rise of Axie Infinity and its popularity in the Philippines it’s only natural to try and ride on that success. Unfortunately the proposal doesn’t even mention Tagalog and there is no evidence provided that this team would be particularly proficient in translating anything in Tagalog. Even if the plan is not perfect, the team will probably deliver quality results if given a chance.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan is essentially the same as with their other language translation proposals. It’s concise yet well laid out. Furthermore, the Gitbook site they have built for tracking and reporting is just beautiful in its simplicity (https://catalyst.revelar.co/). It’s just a pity that this particular proposal was not given the customization and finishing touches it deserves.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very interesting and is in line with the objectives of the challenge, although it is not perfect. The idea is to translate an NFT card game minted at Cardano, called Duo. The proponents are part of the Relevar group and claim that this game is their main play to earn project. What I missed here was a better explanation of workability. What happens in this game? How are matches? What would players be looking to gain? I believe there are many unanswered questions; if the game itself were better detailed, the impact would be better understood. Anyway, I agree that it is necessary to translate projects like this because they can attract a very large niche (players, interested in NFTs and also in profiting from matches). So it is a proposal that is in line with the objective of expanding and popularizing Cardano to East Asia, with only more details being needed to understand well how this process would take place.
f6_assessments.q1: The project has good feasibility, as with impact, only a few simple things need to be improved. Speaking of the script, I thought it was great how the time division is based on weeks. Generally I recommend that proposals be divided into months, but as this one is not that extensive I thought it was right for the proposers to make such a very detailed division. Speaking of the budget, it's broken down into a few parts and I can say that our understanding of how it would be used is solid, but not perfect. Some parts (the most expensive and main ones, something in my opinion), such as translation and marketing services, should be better sorted out. What would these translation services look like? Who would work here, how many hours a week, why would that cost $1850? And who in relation to marketing; how would it happen? It would be essential for us to understand the project's publicity campaign, as it is an essential part of success. I thought the presentation of the team was adequate, we know their names and CVs and also how they relate to Cardano; So about that specifically I have no criticisms to make.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is a part that is a little less adequate than the others. It is said that progress could be tracked via catalyst.revelar.co, but we don't know how often updates would be released or exactly what kind of updates would be. Maybe about the pre-production process of the translations, the partial results? Regarding the Duo Translation page, I found it a very interesting way to understand how the content is being gradually translated. But there is also a question about the frequency of translations and how the Cardano community would be informed about them. Turning now to the final results, this part leaves something to be desired as the proponents focus a lot on translating the game but not how it might affect Cardano's cryptographic community in the Philippines. Did this blockchain actually become more popular there? Were the specific objectives achieved? I think it would be interesting to rephrase the topic.

It seems that the team is capable, being very active through the ADA funds. Besides that, having the CTO from South Africa and being an Afrikaans native speaker is amazing. 
I’ve seen that you’ve submitted the same proposals in other languages, therefore I suppose that this one is just to translate in Filipin. Now, that you don't have a native speaker, probably the 2 weeks required to find someone will be needed and, besides, you must find some Filipinos to audit its work.
About the translation, it should be taken into account that it’s not enough having someone translating to some language. It has to account to the differences between countries as well (Portugal and Brazil, e.g.).
One point that should have been better explored is the game itself. The budget for the translation is $1850, e.g., however I’ve no idea if this is too much or too little since I’ve no idea how the game works (how many cards, words, content, knowledge required, etc.). More than that, if we don’t know the content, we don’t know if we would like to play it or not or if it would be another game that people start to play only to earn something and then disappear
Another point is that you state that is a play-to-earn game, however it not explains how it will work, therefore I have no condition to know if it’s sustainable or not. These are very serious points that should’ve been more explored.
Adding these information would enhance the overall quality of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: While some may argue this proposal fits better under On-Chain Gaming, the fact it is a translation of the current Duo game into Filipino makes it suitable. But where I strongly agree to its Impact and Alignment is by the choice of language itself; Filipino. Axie Infinity's gameplay is 50% coming out of the Philippines. It's high adoption is one of the reason's for the blockchain game's rise over the last year. This indicates an affinity for play-to-earn gameplay in the country so there is a chance Duo can be adopted easier by the population if marketing is done correctly. We have heard stories that Axie Infinity have allowed some Filipinos to buy house, increase their incomes and sustain. living thru P2E. As a former tender assessor for a university this is a sound and rationale decision for Revelar and their goal of not simply translating the language from English to Filipino but to also align the content and jokes to the country's local custom and culture further increases the chances of Duo's success.
f6_assessments.q1: The NFT game is already in production and has had some success. This proposal focusses on the translation of the game content into Filipino so the goal isn't unsurmountable and the plan put forward in this proposal indicates this. The budget is also aligned with how much it would cost to translate an already-released product. Where I strongly agree this project will feasibly meet success is with Filipinos themselves; who are largely educated and can speak and understand English. This is where their translation to include cultural nuance would be done successfully as the bridge to align humour should be easier than say a country whose population does not speak English so hence have never consumed western culture and media. For such a small budget, this is one of Fund 8's proposals that can provide a big bang for our treasury buck. The Revelar team has a proven track record and their bona fides are clearly described including links to their qualifications. It is understandable that no one in the team at this stage knows how to translate from English to Filipino as this is a resource that can be secured once funding is available.
f6_assessments.q2: Revelar has provided their very own Catalyst-related website to provide updates on the translation of Duo from English to Filipino where both Catalyst auditors and the Cardano Community can track progress. In addition, the proposal has listed the KPIs for the translated Duo which seems to err on the conservative side. I have a feeling if DuO is marketed correctly, the Filipino version of Duo has the potential to surpass Axie Infinity users in the country as it could include not only Axie players but also those in the population who may not understand English as well as others who themselves want to participate in P2E. Where I would suggest an improvement to this proposal is the inclusion of other social channels like twitter or Telegram where they can regularly post updates alongside their website and youtube channel. Good luck.

This proposal meets the key metrics indicated in the challenge setting, the creation of a translated version with local context adaptation would  increase the participation of the Cardano community with East Asian residents and  increase in Daily/Monthly Active Wallets.

f6_assessments.q1:
The team described experiences relevant to the development of the project, two team members participated in Plutus Pioneer Program. A translator will be hired to do the translation.

The Revelar team was previously funded on Catalyst and has been developing the Duo game for a few months, at the moment the game is in pre alpha, but it is already possible to see updates on the YouTube channel and on Discord.

There is a budget breakdown, but not enough details. It would be important to have an estimate of the amount of material to be translated to understand the requested budget, amount of hours for development/integration of the translation in the application and more details about the marketing plan. Without these details it is not possible to say whether the budget requested for each part is reasonable.

The proposal presents a realistic timeline for the development of the mentioned steps and deliverables.

The Revelar team considered several realistic risks for the development of the project and proposed adequate solutions to mitigate them.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is clarity in the problem, the solution described in this proposal and how they relate to the challenge.

The proposal contains a simple but objective roadmap appropriate to the complexity of the proposal. There are milestones that can help with the audit.

Metrics were included to evaluate success and there are appropriate KPIs, which is positive for evaluating the performance and evolution of the proposal. My only recommendation would be to include more metrics/KPIs that allow you to evaluate items other than the number of users, such as number of transactions, number of NFTs purchased or transacted by users.

The team created a page where it is possible to follow the development of all proposals related to Catalyst and committed to adding updates related to the development of the proposal.

solution: Partner with native speakers of a different language and culture to expand gameplay reach to reach more people.
